intro: Spermacoce stigmatosa, commonly known as the stigmatose bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a dry, two-valved capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature. Spermacoce stigmatosa is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
